p: Rats were randomly assigned into eight groups each consisting of six rats for diuretic test. Group I was negative control treated with 2 mL/100 g of distilled water used for reconstitutions. Group II was positive control treated with 10 mg/kg furosemide (FURO10). Groups III–V were treated with doses of 100 mg/kg, 200 mg/kg and 400 mg/kg of F. sur aqueous extract, respectively. Whereas, Groups VI–VII were treated with doses of 100 mg/kg, 200 mg/kg, and 400 mg/kg of F. sur 80% methanol extract, respectively. Dose selections was made based on the acute oral toxicity test performed, taking one tenth of the limit dose as the middle dose. Route of administration used for all groups was oral using gavage.
